intro: Dyschoriste madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, typical of the Rubiaceae family.
